When you choose to work with our agents, you can have the peace of mind that comes from knowing that your entire move will be well-coordinated.

Our Virginia Beach, VA, agents can assist you with a quick move across the city to the Woodhouse Corner neighborhood or across the country to Los Angeles. If you're planning on moving to another country, our agents can help you coordinate that as well. At Allied Van Lines, we have more than 85 years of experience with helping individuals, families, and businesses of all sizes relocate to new areas. We connect you with professional local movers who can transport all of your belongings, including your vehicle. We offer free estimates on our moving services and can even find temporary storage facilities for your belongings.

Allied Van Lines has earned the trust of hundreds of Virginia Beach residents as one of the premier moving companies in the area. Experienced agents will carefully coordinate every step of your move and will communicate the details with you from start to finish. Each Virginia Beach mover knows the community well and will ensure that your belongings are delivered safely and promptly.

Call Allied Van Lines today to arrange your move, and obtain the peace of mind that comes with retaining the services of a high-quality moving company. Our agents will be happy to provide you with a free quote and can answer any questions you may have.

What a Move to Virginia Beach Has to Offer

Virginia Beach is a resort city located on the Atlantic Ocean near the mouth of the Chesapeake Bay. This city is steeped in history and is home to the first landing of the English colonists at nearby Cape Henry in 1607, known as "America's First Region." With miles of sandy beaches, hundreds of hotels and restaurants, it has a lively tourist industry. It also has the longest pleasure beach in the world as listed in the Guinness Book of Records.

Once you arrive in the city, you'll want to let the movers unload the truck while you take in some of the sights, such as the world's longest bridge-tunnel, the Chesapeake Bay Bridge-Tunnel, state parks and several historic sites.

With mild winters and hot, humid summers, Virginia Beach's climate is a delight. While it is well known for its tourism, the economy is also supported by the military and agribusiness sectors. Several United States Military bases call Virginia Beach and surrounding areas home, including the United States Navy's NAS Oceana and Training Support Center Hampton Roads, plus the Joint Expeditionary Base East and the NAB Little Creek. The NAS Oceana is the largest employer in the area, and, along with the Training Support Center Hampton Roads, it is considered the largest of such facilities in the world.

Cultural exhibits abound in the city with destinations such as the Virginia Museum of Contemporary Art, the annual Boardwalk Art Show, The Virginia Aquarium and Marine Science Center, the Virginia Beach Amphitheater and 18 sites listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

Tips for Moving to Virginia Beach

Are you planning a move to Virginia Beach? Here are some top tips to help make your transition smooth and enjoyable.

  1. Research the area before your move to become familiar with the city and its neighborhoods.
  2. Choose a reliable moving company like Allied Van Lines to ensure a smooth transition into your new home.
  3. Contact utility companies in advance to have services set up for your new residence.
  4. If you’re relocating for work, research the job market and local employers in Virginia Beach prior to your move.
  5. Get to know your neighbors by attending local events and activities in Virginia Beach.
  6. Visit the DMV ahead of time to get a VA driver’s license or ID card if necessary.
  7. Learn about weather patterns and seasonal changes in Virginia Beach so you can prepare accordingly for any extreme temperatures or storms that may arise during the year.

Frequently Asked Questions

How much do movers cost in Virginia Beach?

The cost of movers in Virginia Beach varies depending on a variety of factors, such as the size of your move, the distance traveled, and the services required. Contact Allied Van Lines to get a free moving quote and learn more about costs associated with your move.

What is the best day and time of year to hire movers in Virginia Beach?

The best day and time of year to hire movers in Virginia Beach is typically during the summer months when the weather is mild. By hiring movers during this time, you can avoid extreme temperatures and bad weather that could cause delays or other issues. Additionally, because summer is a peak moving season, you may be able to find discounts or more availability in terms of services.
